This here is the Family Ranch where we raise alpacas. Their fluffy fleece, wiggly ears, and curious capriciousness are just the best, aren't they?<tab>0<tab>0
Have you spoken with Yavli yonder? He loves alpacas dearly, but the feeling does not appear to be mutual─not with this lot, at any rate.<tab>0<tab>0
This is where we dry harvested coffee beans. We mix them by hand to ensure each and every bean is thoroughly dried.<tab>0<tab>0
Do you see the fruits on the plants here? Those, my friend, are coffee berries. After a lengthy process, they'll become the delicious coffee many have come to know and love.<tab>0<tab>0
To the west you will find Miplu's Mate Garden. While I enjoy a cup of mate tea as much anyone else, coffee is quite lovely as well, don't you think?<tab>0<tab>0

I inspect coffee beans here before they're shipped out, paying particular attention to the weight of each sack. All of our beans are of premium quality, and we cannot afford even the slightest miscalculation in our measurements.<tab>0<tab>0
Have you ever seen someone picking mate leaves? I imagine the opportunities to see such are few and far between.<tab>0<tab>0
Hello, friend. It pleases me to see a traveler come visit us here, so far out of the way.<tab>0<tab>0
Greetings! I take it you're a traveler? If you are looking for a place to rest this eve, we have beds of varying sizes to accommodate guests of all proportions!<tab>0<tab>0

Urqopacha is home to the Pelupelu, and many merchants like myself make the journey to these mountains to trade with them.<tab>They are gracious enough to offer us beds in the inn and a dip in the hot springs at bargain prices. I must admit, being received with such hospitality puts me in high spirits.<tab>0
Welcome to Panaqpelu Retreat! Pray let down your burdens and enjoy our spacious springs as you take in the breathtaking view!<tab>0<tab>0

One may immerse their body in the heat of these springs whilst feeling the gentle brush of the wind on their face. Gazing upon this vista in such a state brings complete peace of mind and soothes the spirit...<tab>0<tab>0

I am one well versed in matters of the spiritual and inconceivable, yet even I am unable to foresee the outcome of the rite of succession. I can only pray for continued peace in this land.<tab>0<tab>0

What do you think of our garden? Magnificent, isn't it?<tab>0<tab>0

Before you lies Karryorzar the Gracious. See to it that you comport yourself with dignity.<tab>0<tab>0

Hate to say it, but the drink's the only thing stopping me from losing the plot altogether. Don't suppose you'd care to join me?<tab>0
After what happened to Queen Sphene, I'm at a loss for words.<tab>You know, she once came and spoke with me about fishing, with great interest. Even now, I can still see her face, clear as day.<tab>0
Nasty business over at Solution Nine, with the sentries running amok like that. Thankfully, we've been spared anything of the sort here, but I can't help but worry...<tab>0<tab>0

What do you think will change once the young Gulool Ja takes to the throne?<tab>For people like me, it's unlikely we'd find ourselves out of work, so I'm not worried about that. I do hope that he brings a bit of stability to the place, though.<tab>0

As much as I'd prefer not to venture outside, my work here is the only reason I escaped the turmoil in Everkeep.<tab>To think that my research could be linked in any way to such a catastrophe. I am considering my future very carefully indeed...<tab>0

On a break, huh? Don't mind us, we were just chatting about the recent goings-on in Everkeep. It sounds like a guest of Queen Sphene's fought off a bunch of rampaging sentries.<tab>What!? That was you!? In that case, you have my gratitude.<tab>0

Time for a break, is it? We were just talking about this and that. So Gulool Ja will take the throne, with Wuk Lamat as his guardian, it seems.<tab>Despite what some might say, I'm not too concerned about it. If he's anything like his father Gulool Ja Ja, I'm sure things will work out. That Wuk Lamat seems a good sort, as well.<tab>0

Even without Queen Sphene, all of the essential systems are operating as normal.<tab>While our daily lives haven't faced much disruption, everyone seems rather on edge. At least, that's the impression I get from those in Everkeep whenever they place an order with us.<tab>0

A friend of mine lives in Everkeep. We often ate vegetables together, but I haven't seen her since the disturbance.<tab>The fact I can still remember her means she's alive, though she could be injured. Perhaps I should try paying her a visit.<tab>0
Without Queen Sphene, things just aren't the same. Even the vegetables seem somewhat lifeless. Hmm... Perhaps I'm just imagining it?<tab>0<tab>0
A good proportion of the electrope mined here was for military use. Without that, there's no telling what will happen to this place.<tab>0<tab>0

It appears that two collector acquaintances of mine recently...ah, passed on. I asked around in Everkeep, but hardly anyone remembers them. It's just as I thought...<tab>To suddenly lose all recollection of those you once knew... Doesn't that bother the people wearing regulators?<tab>0
Is it true that we can go beyond the barrier? I would like nothing more than to free myself of this wretched lightning, but Yyasulani is my home.<tab>0<tab>0

Yesterland has fallen silent, its vibrant lights snuffed out. <sigh> What a poor sight Living Memory has become.<tab>I am glad my little sister is not here to witness this.<tab>0
Did you see? Asyle Volcane has been shut down as well. It was a dream of mine to take my mother to the hot springs there, but now it can never be...<tab>0<tab>0

I thought if I waited here long enough, my family would eventually become Endless, and join me here in Living Memory. I realize the futility of it all, and yet a part of me cannot let go.<tab>If you are indeed the one who shut down the other terminals, I beg you─shut down the main terminal as well. Free me from this longing, this heartache...<tab>0

I can hardly wait till we start building our next train.<tab>Oh, I've got so many ideas! Maybe we can build one that can travel underwater. Or one that can fly!<tab>0

Zekowa and Kwikana are awfully excited to finally be getting on with work. That isn't to say I'm not enthused myself, mind.<tab>But we can't just run headlong into trouble like we used to. We'll need to cooperate with the Dustwatch if we want things done right.<tab>0

The sky's finally clear of those ships, so it seems the danger's passed. For now, at least.<tab>My officers'll tell you I have a carefree attitude on most days, but when there's trouble, I'll be there front and center.<tab>0

Hhusatahwi owes you and your companions a great debt. Not only for helping against those mechanical monsters, but also that incident with the Vulture.<tab>I'll be kicking myself for some time yet over that. Still, I'll learn from my mistakes and be a better officer for it.<tab>0

My apologies for laughing earlier. Your friend painted an image so far removed from the Sphene we know, I couldn't help myself.<tab>0<tab>0

<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, you came!
